humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the invasive lobular carcinoma in the left breast is 3.3 cm in size. According to the rules provided, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm, and since this tumor is 3.3 cm, it does not meet the criteria for a T3 tumor. The report does not indicate any direct extension to the chest wall or skin, so it is not a T4 tumor. Therefore, based on the size of the tumor, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, for the left breast and axillary contents, the tumor size is stated as 3.3 cm (B. Breast, Left, and Axillary Contents, Modified Radical Mastectomy). According to the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, 7th Edition, a T2 stage is defined as a tumor size of 2.1 to 5.0 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.
